prs.title: solana: Handle transferring mint authority using SPL Multisig
prs.truncated_body:
### Context:

Currently, there are instructions to safely handle transferring token mint authority to-and-from the NTT Manager - `token_authority` PDA.

However, with SPL Multisig support, these instructions need to be modified to handle all cases.

### List of Abbreviations:

* `Multisig(...)` = any generic SPL Multisig with signers …
* `Multisig(TA, ...)` = SPL Multisig with m = 1 and `

Update `claim_token_authority`and add `claim_token_authority_to_multisig` to account for multisig token authority

prs.title: ci: Fix `call didn't revert at a lower depth than cheatcode call depth` forge error in EVM tests
prs.truncated_body:
With Foundry v1 release, some forge tests have been failing with this error. 
This PR fixes this by adding `/// forge-config: default.allow_internal_expect_revert = true` above the test function.



See https://book.getfoundry.sh/cheatcodes/expect-revert#description for reference:
> Selectively by using an inline configuration entry where it is DEEMED SAFE:
> Add `/// forge-config: default.

commits.message: Fix forge tests `call didn't revert at a lower depth` failure

prs.title: op-batcher: remove `ThrottleInterval` and split block loading and batch publishing into separate goroutines
prs.truncated_body:
This moves the hybrid "event + interval" model for DA throttling to a purely event driven model. There are two events which can trigger throttling: (1) a change in the amount of pending data building up in the batcher and (2) a change in the active sequencer which the batcher is pointing at. 

A happy side effect is that the batcher's loading, publishing and throttling workloads are broken up an

commits.message:
op-batcher: overhaul throttling, reading and writing loops

* no longer evaluate throttling conditions on a ticker
* break main loop into "reading" and "writing"
* reading loop signals to throttling and writing when ALL blocks are loaded (this could be done in a more fine grained way, even when each block is loaded)
* these run concurrently

readloop unblocks writing loop once, and then writing loop goes forever (pausing when it runs out of data)

tests pass but timeout due to bad shutdown
allow for receipt handling when receipt and err are both nil
split shutdownCtx into producers and consumers
throttling loop ranges over a channel, does not take a context
processReceiptsLoop ranges over a channel, does not take a context
writeLoop uses a ticker instead of a sleep
WIP: add throughput test for batcher
make txQueue local, not global state
make pendingBytesUpdated a local, not global

read and write loop communicate with a channel

no more ticker required

remove test

I'm not sure it is adding any value. May return to it in future
add activeSequencerChanged channel and wire it up to onActiveSequencerChanged hook in active rollup provider

prs.title: Ask to delete EL data dir on make start-[client]
prs.truncated_body:
I have now several times run `start-geth` without realizing it always deletes the EL data directory causing me to need to reset my local node. This PR addresses this so when any EL starts it checks if the eth data dir exists and asks if it should delete it or not (similar to how `make start` works).

Furthermore, this PR also addresses the case where on linux (Ubuntu under WSL) using Docker Desk

commits.message: ask to delete EL data dir on make start-[client]

prs.title: Improvements to signal handling
prs.truncated_body:
This PR makes the following improvements to signal handling, where during graceful shutdown we now:
- Only stop services which we called `Start()` on.
- Fixes critical section issue where we can call `StopAll` twice during shutdown if signal was received while in the middle of Startup.
- Simplifies the signal handling to use a simple blocking channel instead of `errgroup`. 
- Force kill if not

prs.title: re-test sorobans against their observations with core-chosen rust compiler
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This just adds an entry to `make check` to re-run the tests of each soroban module using the toolchain that stellar-core is building soroban with. This will catch early any divergence from observation caused by differences between the rust toolchain soroban tested itself against in CI vs. the one core is being built with. It's a small window of difference, but possible. 

Resolv

commits.message: re-test sorobans against their observations with core-chosen rust compiler

prs.title: [ci] Update to golangci-lint version compatible with go 1.23

Local execution of lint.sh results in the following error despite the installed version of golang being the official 1.23.6 binary for linux/arm64.

Error: can't load config: the Go language version (go1.22) used to build golangci-lint is lower than the targeted Go version (1.23.6)
Failed executing command with error: can't load config: the Go language versi

prs.title: Add dependency constraints on `cardano-coin-selection`
prs.truncated_body:
This pull request adds dependency constraints to the `cardano-coin-selection` package, as this package is a likely target for releasing on CHaP.

We also remove the direct dependency on the `extra` package, because it's easy.

prs.title: Testing improvements

# Description

This PR includes some testing-related improvements.

1. Move `EnableMSTestRunner` to Directory.Build.props
2. Add MSTestVersion property to Directory.Build.props so that it's updated in once place.
3. Update MSTest from 3.7 to 3.8
4. Enable the recommended set of MSTest analyzers using `MSTestAnalysisMode`, and address some of the analyzers warnings/errors
